channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Big plastic sheet in road and flytipping, 18th September
item.description:
Large plastic sheet half in the road along with lots of fly tipping and litter blowing onto the street. Looks such a mess and dangerous for the cars getting onto the A road. Needs clearing away and moving immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bronze Age Way, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No enough space to enter my road, 18th September
item.description:
When there is a car parked at the entrance of this T road (my house is no.87), I cannot fit my car through without either scratching the parked car or scratching my car on the side poles. This is a big issue for me and often prevents me getting in and out of my road. I have a 4x4 car (Jaguar F Pace) and it’s impossible to get in and out with a car parked there. I’ve tried speaking to residents on the road and asking them not to park there but this is not helping. Can you please enforce some parking restrictions on the entrance of this T road so that no parking is allowed there or remove the poles/railings on the other side so I can get on the kerb in the situation a car is parked there. I cannot keep facing this issue everytime I leave my house, it’s becoming a real problem. I have already scratched my car 3 times and scratched others too (and forced to pay for their repairs). Please help me resolve this. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Luffield Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: No lights work, 18th September
item.description:
In Bromley hill there a bus stop DC that as no lights it’s in darkness when waiting for a bus you have put your phone light on so the driver can see you at the bus stop can you get in touch with TFL and let them know what the problem is

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Bromley Hill, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive leaves during autumn making payment slippy, 18th September
item.description:
During autumn, all the leaves fill our gardens and pavement outside of our houses which are opposite a small green full of trees and make the pavement very slippy. We are all in our 70s 80s along our pavement and either side of me are disabled so can’t walk very well. I’ve just had surgery as I have unstable ankles and I just wondered if they could be cleared when you start clearing the pavements because we never get done
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Larch Way, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outise number 26, 18th September
item.description:
Young rate tree need re-staking or fixing the current stakes. one of the stakes has completely come of the ground and and the other is very wobbly. with the wind the young tree is leaning down. it needs re-staking urgently or else most likely it will fail and collapse

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Belsize Square, Belsize Park, London

item.title: Misused rubbish bin- danger to drivers (3), 18th September
item.description:
This rubbish bin is daily used for domestic rubbish. Wind often takes debris and bags to the middle of the road and it is an accident waiting to happen. I have already witnessed a motorist and a cyclist falling trying to avoid the debris. The solution is to remove the bin or to apply existing legislation and fine the recurring offenders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, West Eaton Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: HUMAN: RED ROUTE Oxford St & side streets 20 Sept onwards, 18th September
item.description:
Westminster council has handed over Oxford Street & at least part of the side streets, the roads, to Transport for London. Takes effect Saturday 20 Sept. 2025. Reporting road problems, we can use the tfl tool: streetcare.tfl.gov.uk. Can we also still report Oxford St road issues to FixmyStreet?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 400, Oxford Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Road Sign, 18th September
item.description:
As seen in the photo the road sign is broken and not visible for cars coming down the road, causes a trip hazard for both pedestrians and vehicles. Have reported this weeks ago and still not fixed. Also causes sounds of scraping in the wind, needs to be fixed asap please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 221, Consort Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
